bootstrap: For sth like jens/config.js, used in lively.bootstrap.
Loaded to initialize the base Lively system.
Lively modules to start a world (after the bootstrapFiles are loaded).
cop: Dynamically compile layered methods for improving their execution performance.

get.code: function() { return typeof document !== 'undefined' && document.cookie ? document.cookie.split(';').map(function(ea) { return ea.split('='); }).reduce(function(cookie, kv) { cookie[kv[0].trim()] = decodeURIComponent(kv[1]); return cookie; }, {}) : {}; }

ssl.name: ssl-auth
ssl.doc: User defined by SSL client certificate

get.code:
function() { var subj = Config.get('ssl-subject'); 
 return subj ? {user: subj.CN, email: subj.emailAddress} : null; }

auth: File containing the authentication information and access rules
Users' default world placed in their workspace
Routes for user management, e.g. login, logout, registration

user.name: UserName
user.doc: UserName identifies the current Lively user

set.code: function(val) { return lively.LocalStorage.set('UserName', val ? val.replace(/ /g, '_') : val); }
function(val) { return lively.LocalStorage.set('UserEmail', val ? val.replace(/ /g, '_') : val); }

lively.Network.name: location
lively.Network.doc: The interpreted document.location or something similar for non-browser environments.

lively.Network.name: proxyURL
lively.Network.doc: URL that acts as a proxy for network operations, computed at system start.

Lively2Lively: Is the lively server this world is started from considered public?
Whether to automatically connect to a session tracker server and enable Lively-to-Lively connections.
Central server to connect to for inter-realm Lively-to-Lively connections. Nullify to deactivate.
Allow eval actions from other Lively worlds.
Show a morph that indicates whether lively2lively is running and which provides access to collab actions.
Visually log when receiving a lively2lively message.
In milliseconds. Ensure staying connected to the tracker by sending regular heartbeats. Change to undefined to disable heartbeats.

server.nodejs.name: nodeJSURL
server.nodejs.doc: Base URL of Lively subservers. Computed at system start.

server.nodejs.name: nodeJSWebSocketURL
server.nodejs.doc: Optional url to be used for websocket connections. By default the normal nodeJSURL will be used but under certain circumstances it can be blocked for websocket traffic. In this case you can set this aleernate url, e.g. to re-route to a certain port.

set.code: function(val) { Config._nodeJSWebSocketURL = val; var sessionTracker = typeof lively !== 'undefined' && lively.lang && lively.lang.Path('net.SessionTracker').get(lively); if (sessionTracker) { sessionTracker.localSessionTrackerURL = new URL(val.replace(/\$/, '') + '/SessionTracker/'); if (lively.Config.get('lively2livelyAutoStart')) sessionTracker.resetSession(); } return val; }

lively.persistence: if a class is not found during deserializing a place holder object can be created instead of raising an error
Whether to store an HTML document showing a static version of the serialized world.
Loads up Lively and creates a complete new world from scratch instead of using a serialized one.
Whether to remove all the DOM child nodes of the DOM element that is used to display the World.

Will remove connections and connected objects when connection targets in the object graph can only be reached through the connection itself. Can be disabled per connection using the garbageCollect: false option.
lively.Storage: The default stores created once IndexedDB is opened.
lively.bindings: DEPRECATED! some widgets self connect to a private model on startup, but it doesn't seem necessary, turn on to override
For triggering a breakpoint when an connect update throws an error
Show data-flow arrows when doing a connect using the UI.
lively.morphic: Deprecated option, defaults to true. Used in 2011 when Lively2 was being developed.
Allows easy object duplication using the Shift key.

For the engine/piano demo (and any other simulation interacting with unmoving mouse) it is necessary to generate a mouseMove event after each tick set this true in localconfig if you need this behavior
Confirm system shutdown from the user
load serialized worlds instead of building them from Javascript
where the local web server runs
determins the pixels to snap to alt-dragging the drag halo
Number of statusmessages that should appear at one time on the screen.
Halo Items can be made colorful for better recognition.
lively.ModuleSystem: The URL or path to the core/ Lively modules. Dynamically determined in bootstrap.
So modules know where they were required from.
Timeout in ms after which to run a module load check. Make it falsy to disable the check.
In case a world is loaded without being able to reach the application cache (probably because the server cannot be reached) show a warning on world load.
Alt-click on morphs assigns them to the global variable 'that'.
don't show confirmation dialog when navigating a link
User Platform Keys (Ctrl und Windows and Meta under Mac as command key)
lively.morphic.Connectors: Connectors / lines can "dock" to magnet points of morphs.
lively.morphic.Events: Use the meta modifier (maps to Command on the Mac) instead of alt
enable or disable showing halo items when Command/Control-clicking
enable grab halo (alternative to shadow) on objects in the hand.
Switch between native event handling and Googles Pointerevents library
Enforce the use of only one hand on mobile devices
lively.debugging: Ignore function logging through the prototype.js wrap mechanism rhino will give more useful exception info
Whether to make logging/alerting highly visible in the UI
Whether to throw Debugger exceptions in rewritten code

set.code: function(v) { lively.Config._defaultTabSize = v; module('lively.ide.CodeEditor').runWhenLoaded(function() { lively.morphic.CodeEditor.prototype.style.tabSize = v; lively.whenLoaded(function() { lively.ide.allCodeEditors().invoke('setTabSize', v); }); }); return v; }

lively.morphic.Text: Deprecated. Wether Lively takes care of undoing text changes or leaves it to the browser.
lively.morphic.CodeEditor: In which pt size code appears.
Whether to use the ace.ajax editor for code editing.

lively.morphic.CodeEditor.name: aceShowGutterInObjectEditor
lively.morphic.CodeEditor.doc: Enables the line number gutter in Object Editor

lively.morphic.CodeEditor.name: aceShowGutterInWorkspace
lively.morphic.CodeEditor.doc: Enables the line number gutter in Workspace

lively.morphic.CodeEditor: Show a vertical line at the print margin column.
Indicators for indents in the beginning of lines.
Show syntax errors in programming language mode?
Should behaviors be enabled? (auto insert closing parens and quotation marks)
when enabled all JS files udner core/ are read on startup nd their content is used to compute word completions
When a doit eval results in an error a error message pops up.
Print eval results in message boxes of the code editor morph.
Eval that changes semantics of how object literals and if statements are evaluated.
Visibly show errors when improved JavaScript eval transformation fail
Quickly jump to next / prev characters using Cmd/Ctrl-, and Cmd/Ctrl-.
Eval markers are code selections that can be rerun by pressing a code. Useful for live development and quick testing.
Include the settings menu item in the codeeditor context menu
Based on AST, make code draggable
Make number sin code editors scrubbable or not

lively.morphic.CodeEditor.name: useEmacsyKeys
lively.morphic.CodeEditor.doc: Keybindings that resemble what you expect from an emacs.

lively.ide.Search: Patterns for files to exclude from grep code search.

lively.morphic.StyleSheets.name: baseThemeStyleSheetURL
lively.morphic.StyleSheets.doc: The base theme CSS file location.

lively.morphic.StyleSheets.name: ipadThemeStyleSheetURL
lively.morphic.StyleSheets.doc: The ipad theme CSS file location.

lively.PartsBin: Whether parts are cached after they are loaded the first time
lively.ide.tools: Ratio how much vertical space the sourcePane vs. the list panes get by default in SCB.
When loading lively.ide.SystemCodeBrowserAddons, install history browsing for all future browsers, or not.
When saving a method (property) with a changed name, save the old behavior, or loose it. If not set (undefined), you are asked.
lively.ide.tools.SelectionNarrowing: Show the input line at top or bottom?
Wiki: Show tool flap that gives access to wiki tools.
lively.Worker: Milliseconds a lively.Worker that is automatically added to the worker pool is kept alive.
Changesets: track changes and provide a UI for a changesets-based worlkflow
restore changes automatically on world load
lively.morphic.tools.MenuBar: Should a menu bar be opened on world load?

lively.morphic.tools.MenuBar.name: menuBarEntries
lively.morphic.tools.MenuBar.doc: The actual menubar entries currently loaded

lively.morphic.tools.MenuBar: Which menu bar entries to add by default? Specifies modules that should implement a getMenuBarEntries() method.
lively.VM: jsx is a JS language extension for the react framework. When enabled code editors will know how to parse jsx.
babel.js is an ES6 / JSX transformer. When enabled will be used to transform evaled code.
babel.js is an ES6 / JSX transformer. When enabled will be used to transform evaled code.
